channel.title: BUbuisnessAndMarket
channel.description: This is a randomly ordered feed of the most recent entries from BUbuisnessAndMarket, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: Nancy Pelosi retires from legendary career as Obama hails ‘one of the best speakers the House of Representatives has ever had’
item.description: “I will not be seeking reelection to Congress,” Pelosi said in a video address to voters.

item.title: Boeing won’t face a criminal conspiracy charge over two 737 Max jetliner crashes that killed 346 people
item.description: As part of a deal to drop the charge, the American aerospace company has agreed to pay or invest an additional $1.1 billion in fines.

item.title: Zohran Mamdani is New York’s first millennial Mayor—experts share how the young leader’s style will differ from his boomer predecessors
item.description: Higher minimum wage for young workers, remote working and a 4-day workweek could get a spotlight thanks to New York’s first millennial Mayor

item.title: Jamie Dimon predicts AI will shorten the workweek: ‘My guess is the developed world be working three-and-a-half days a week’
item.description: He thinks it’ll eliminate jobs, but we can steer our way out of disaster.

item.title: Tests showing Chinese-made buses can be stopped remotely prompt Norwegian pullback
item.description: The company said tests, done in underground mines to block signals, used both new Yutong buses and three-year-old models from Dutch maker VDL.

item.title: If you own a ‘safe’ investment-grade bond fund, better check the holdings
Tesla investor meeting: What to know as Musk’s $1 trillion pay package at stake
Stocks trimming sharp losses in final hour as investors ponder valuations — live
Why one firm’s report on the jobs market contributed to Thursday’s stock selloff
U.S. stocks close sharply lower as investors question valuations and jobs market
